column1: What is your current professional affiliation?
column2: What content would you like to see in Aperture? (1 = would definitely want this, 5 = I would not want this at all)
column15: What platform(s) would you suggest for referring to code in manuscript? (Please select all that apply)
column20: What factors contribute to your decision where to publish? (1 = most important, 5 = least important)
column31: What reviewer model would you like to see in Aperture? (1 = I would definitely want this , 5 = I would not want this at all)
column39: Which of these aspects do you think is important when reviewing code? (Check all that apply)
column43: Would you be willing to review code?
column44: If you are willing to review code, which of these aspects would you be willing to review? (Check all that apply)
column49: Would you be willing to review computational notebooks?
column51: Would you be willing to review data?
column52: Should submissions have to be on a pre-archive system?
column53: What sustainability model would you prefer? (Rank 1 = most desirable, 5 = least desirable)
column64: Should OHBM have an official publishing platform?
column65: Should the publishing platform aim to increase the OHBM revenues?
column66: Would you like OHBM to take on permanent financial support of Aperture to offset costs?
column67: Would you like OHBM to provide financial help for Aperture for the first few years until it becomes sustainable?
column68: How would you prefer that Editorial management of Aperture (i.e. select EIC, editors, editorial board, publication type) is decided? (Please check all that apply)

column9: Datasets (i.e. Aperture should also be a data hosting platform)
column11: Methods articles (data acquisition, hardware, protocols etc.)
column27: Linking papers to code and data
column29: Ability to update publications and code in a tracked way
column32: Anonymous reviews with option for reviewer to give name
column33: Anonymous reviews with reviews published with paper
column35: Commentary from readers on manuscript page post-publication

column56: Open access: no submission charge, reduced charge for OHBM members to publish, (i.e. charges offset by [increased] OHBM membership fee)

column58: Paywalled: free to submit/publish; free subscription to OHBM members, but costs covered by increased membership fees
